TopicTitle: What Has Happened To EVE Clouds!?!?!

Articles.Content:
Hey everyone. I have had EVE for a while but i recently installed scatterer, parallax 2.0, and Kopernicus. After restarting ksp looked better then ever. 

But then, tragedy struck. 

While i was at the ksc, i decided to tinker around with the eve configurations a bit to see what it would do. It appeared to do nothing so i switched back to a vessel. I then noticed ksp to look rather dull and found that the typical beautiful clouds that EVE brings have VANISHED!!

I checked planets like Eve and found that all of the visuals including stuff like the bubbles were still totally fine. Stuff on the kerbin terrain seemed to be completely unaffected as well. 

I would provide a screenshot of the config thing i messed with and the after affects, but i don't know how to upload images. Soooooo, knowing how to do that would help too.

Any advice would be appreciated.

Thanks!

P.S. I would like to mention that I tried uninstalling and re-installing EVE to no affect, so I don think its that. 

Edited Monday at 12:56 AM by oli123314

You have to upload images to an external platform like imgur and link them here. The forum will not store images for you.

As for your issue, EVE on it's own does nothing, it needs a config pack that tells it what to display. This may be BoulderCO, Spectra, or whatever you have installed. You likely broke one of the config pack files, so try re-installing whatever config pack you're using for EVE.
